question: Under the Scheme of 1793 implemented by Cornwallis, which was the highest Civil Court in India?
option1: Supreme Court of Judicature of Calcutta
explanation: Under the Scheme of 1793, the Sadar Diwani Adalat which consisted of the Governor-General and Council continued to be the highest Civil Court subject to appeals to the King-in-Council when the subject-matter of the dispute was of the value of Â£ 5,000 or more. But one important reform introduced by the scheme was that Sadar Diwani Adalat was also constituted as a Court of Supervision and Inspection over the Mofussil Diwani Adalats so that administration of justice could be toned up.
